byline.original: By MICHAEL J. DE LA MERCED

abstract: I.B.M. named Virginia Rometty as its new chief executive, certifying her status as one of the most powerful women in technology and joining a list that includes Meg Whitman and Sheryl Sandberg.
snippet: I.B.M. named Virginia Rometty as its new chief executive, certifying her status as one of the most powerful women in technology and joining a list that includes Meg Whitman and Sheryl Sandberg.
lead_paragraph: I.B.M. named Virginia Rometty as its new chief executive, certifying her status as one of the most powerful women in technology. She joins a list that includes Meg Whitman, the newly installed chief executive of Hewlett-Packard; Sheryl Sandberg, the chief operating officer of Facebook; and Safra Catz, the chief financial officer of Oracle. Read more »
